#Text=County Down
#Text=County Down
#Text=( Irish : Contae an Dúin ) is a county in Northern Ireland .
#Text=Cities
#Text=( Béal Feirste , " mouth of the river bank " ) - partly in County Antrim — the capital and largest city of Northern Ireland .
#Text=It is also the second largest city on the island of Ireland ( after Dublin , the capital of the Republic of Ireland ) , and the fifteenth largest in the United Kingdom .
#Text=Shattered by more than three decades of paramilitary conflict , Belfast has undergone a renaissance and is now a vibrant , modern city .
#Text=( Lios na gCearrbhach , " fort of the stream " ) - partly in County Antrim , location of the Irish Linen Museum
#Text=( Iúr Cinn Trá , " gap of the north " ) - partly in County Armagh in south-eastern of Northern Island between the Mourne Mountains and the Ring of Gullion
#Text=Towns
#Text=( Beannchar ) - large wealthy town on the coast
#Text=( Dún Pádraig , " Patrick 's stronghold " ) - Believed to be the burial place of Saint Patrick , check out the St Patrick 's Centre
#Text=( Ard Mhic Nasca ) - with the Ulster Folk and Transport Museum
#Text=( An Caisleán Nua ) - seaside resort town
#Text=( Dún Dónaill )
#Text=( Baile Nua na hArda ) - the Scrabo Tower and the Somme Heritage Centre
#Text=( Droichead na Banna ) - a number of ancient sites as well as the last remaining of the old established Irish linen Jacquard weavers in Ireland
#Text=( Ceathrú Aodha Dhuibh , " Black Hugh 's quarter " )
#Text=Villages
#Text=( Cromghlinn ) - village with significant amounts of Georgian architecture
#Text=( Baile Loch Cuan ) - a number of castles and locations used in the filming of Game of Thrones
#Text=( Caisleán Uidhilín , " Uidhilín 's castle " ) - including forest park
#Text=( Port a ' Pheire , " landing place of the ferry " ) - and the Exploris aquarium
#Text=Other destinations
#Text=( na Beanna Boirche ) - range popular with hikers
#Text=Talk
#Text=English is the primary language , although you may find it a challenge understanding as locals talk very fast and have a distinct accent from the rest of Ireland .
#Text=Get in
#Text=Most visitors will arrive in Belfast City Airport or Belfast International at Aldergrove .
#Text=While ' George Best City Airport ' is right in the city , the International is 20 miles ( 32 km ) away by Motorway , so plan your transportation accordingly .
#Text=Get around
#Text=There is a limited bus service between several towns in County Down , but many must connect in Belfast .
#Text=The best way to see around is to hire a car , as distances are far too great for cycling .
#Text=See
#Text=The Ards Peninsula has many ' typical ' Northern Irish towns which are interesting to travel around .
#Text=Do
#Text=Visit the Mourne Mountains .
#Text=Trek the mountain paths for nice rivers and a great view over Newcastle towards the top .
#Text=Alternatively , drive around them for wonderful scenery ( on a good weather day ) and quaint mountain walls before reaching Silent Valley and looping back around the other side .
#Text=Go next
#Text=north to County Antrim
#Text=west to County Armagh
